H0.text: The medical term bariatric refers (increasingly politically correctly) to what human condition. Overweight

H1.text: The medical term bariatric refers (increasingly politically correctly) to what human condition. Malnourished

H2.text: The medical term bariatric refers (increasingly politically correctly) to what human condition. Diabetic

H3.text: The medical term bariatric refers (increasingly politically correctly) to what human condition. Obese

A4.text: Surgery for severe obesity is associated with long-term weight loss, improvement in obesity-related conditions, and decreased overall mortality

A5.text: People are classified as obese when their body mass index (BMI)—a person's weight divided by the square of the person's height—is over 30 kg/m2; the range 25–30 kg/m2 is defined as overweight
